How to Start Blogging

December 10, 2015

Here are the basic steps for how to get started with Github and Jekyll. Posts are located until the _posts directory. The files are in markdown format. File names need to be specifically named and the top of each file needs to contain specific YAML Frontmatter. See current posts for usage:

Install Jekyll

There are several dependecies required before you install Jekyll:

  1. Make sure you have the latest version of XCode.
  2. Ruby
  3. Ruby Gems
  4. NodeJS
  5. Python 2.7

Now install Jekyll:

Clone Repository

The website is created under the gh branch and not the main branch. The website is launched through the main branch. Clone the repository where you want it on your local computer.

When you have made changes to the website make sure to commit those changes

Publish Website

In order to publish the website, you have to compile the pages. Within the ‘gh’ branch, type:
